summary.para: Replaces a file name's extension at the end of a path string with a new extension. If the path string does not end with an extension, the new extension is added.
This function differs from in that it accepts paths with "\", "\?" and "\?\UNC" prefixes.
Note This function should be used in place of to prevent the possibility of a buffer overrun.

param.name: pszPath
param.para: A pointer to the path string. When this function returns successfully, this value points to the same string, but with the renamed or added extension.

param.name: cchPath
param.para: The size of the buffer pointed to by pszPath, in characters.

param.name: pszExt
param.para: A pointer to the new extension string. The leading '.' character is optional. In the case of an empty string (""), any existing extension in the path string is removed.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Retrieves a pointer to the first character in a path following the drive letter or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) server/share path elements.
This function differs from in that it accepts paths with "\", "\?" and "\?\UNC" prefixes.

param.name: pszPath
param.para: A pointer to the path string.

param.name: ppszRootEnd
param.para: The address of a pointer that, when this function returns successfully, points to the first character in a path following the drive letter or UNC server/share path elements. If the path consists of only a root, this value will point to the string's terminating null character.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Removes the "\?" prefix, if present, from a file path.

param.name: pszPath
param.para: A pointer to the path string. When this function returns successfully, the same path string will have had the prefix removed, if the prefix was present. If no prefix was present, the string will be unchanged.

param.name: cchPath
param.para: The size of the buffer pointed to by pszPath, in characters.

returns.para: This function returns S_OK if the prefix was removed, S_FALSE if the path did not have a prefix to remove, or an HRESULT failure code.

summary.para: Removes all file and directory elements in a path except for the root information.
This function differs from in that it accepts paths with "\", "\?" and "\?\UNC" prefixes.
Note This function should be used in place of to prevent the possibility of a buffer overrun.

param.name: pszPath
param.para: A pointer to the path string. When this function returns successfully, this string contains only the root information taken from that path.

param.name: cchPath
param.para: The size of the buffer pointed to by pszPath, in characters.

returns.para: This function returns S_OK if the path was truncated, S_FALSE if the path was already just a root, or an HRESULT failure code.

summary.para: Determines if a path string is a valid Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path, as opposed to a path based on a drive letter.
This function differs from in that it also allows you to extract the name of the server from the path.

param.name: pszPath
param.para: A pointer to the path string.

param.name: ppszServer
param.para: A pointer to a string that, when this function returns successfully, receives the server portion of the UNC path. This value can be NULL if you don't need this information.

returns.para: Returns TRUE if the string is a valid UNC path; otherwise, FALSE.
